clinical_study.brief_title: EEG Changes With Guided Online Meditation
clinical_study.official_title: EEG Changes With Meditation: A Proposal to Analyze EEG Changes With a Simple, Online, Guided Meditative Tool.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective trial enrolling healthy volunteers, including novice meditators and experienced meditators. Subjects will undergo an EEG at baseline and again after 6 weeks. During the 6 weeks, subjects will be asked to meditate twice a day, atleast minutes each time.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a prospective trial enrolling healthy volunteers, including novice meditators and experienced meditators. Subjects will undergo an EEG at baseline and again after 6 weeks. During the 6 weeks, subjects will be asked to meditate twice a day, 12 minutes each time.

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative EEG measure changes in wave oscillations
primary_outcome.description: Changes in time-frequency oscillations of EEG waves in fT^2/Hz

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative EEG measure changes in wave amplitude
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in amplitude of EEG waves in fT

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative EEG measure changes in wave latency
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in latency of EEG waves in ms

arm_group.description: Meditation ≥ 30 min per day for at least 5 days per week over the past 1 year
No meditation practice in the previous year and < 20 entire lifetime hours

intervention.description: . IK is a meditation that can be learned quickly and requires approximately 12 minutes, twice a day of practice. This regimen was chosen because of its simplicity making it an excellent way to introduce meditation to beginners. IK does not incorporate a spiritual or religious focus
The ENOBIO 32 EEG device is an investigational device under US federal law which is a 24-bit EEG data reader which is a wearable wireless device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. 18 years or older
2. Novice or expert meditator
Novice meditator: No meditation practice in the previous year and < 20 entire lifetime hours
Expert meditator: Meditation ≥ 30 min per day for at least 5 days per week over the past 1 year
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of any neurological condition (i.e. Parkinson's disease, Alzheimer's disease, Huntington's disease, brain tumors, brain surgery, or multiple sclerosis)
2. History of depression, currently being treated with antidepressants
3. History of any psychiatric disorder, within last 5 years (i.e. anxiety, psychosis, posttraumatic stress disorder, attention deficit hyperactive disorder)
4. Current use of cognition-enhancing medications
5. Active history (within the last 5 years) of alcohol or drug abuse (> 10 drinks per week)
6. History (within the last 5 years) of stroke/aneurysm
7. Recent history (< 3 months) of seizures
8. Non-English speaking
